title: How to Do a Keg Stand

steps.title: Tap the keg and have some beers.
steps.content: Tap the keg and have some beers. You'll feel better about the task at hand and it tests how well you tapped the keg before you put your face near it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Round up your 3 helpful friends.
steps.content: Round up your 3 helpful friends. On subsequent attempts all 3 may not be needed, but if you're all just learning, this will work best.

steps.title: Pump/prime the keg so it's ready to go.
steps.content: Pump/prime the keg so it's ready to go. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Agree on a 'stop/get-me-down"'
steps.content: Agree on a 'stop/get-me-down"' signal for you (the drinker) to use. You won't be able to talk or use your arms so a signal such as "3 short grunts" or "bending both knees" is preferable.

steps.title: Pick the 2 strongest of your 3 friends.
steps.content: Pick the 2 strongest of your 3 friends. They will be the 'lifters'. The lifters' job is to help you into the proper keg stand position, help you stay there, and help you get down fairly gracefully when you're done. [3] X Research source

steps.title: The 3rd friend will operate whatever kind of valve releases the beer from the keg at the end of the hose on the tap.
steps.content: The 3rd friend will operate whatever kind of valve releases the beer from the keg at the end of the hose on the tap. All taps are different, so it depends on your tap, but you get the idea.

steps.title: Stand with the keg (which in the best case scenario will be lifted off the ground slightly, like on a stool or in a trash can full of ice) in front of you.
steps.content: Stand with the keg (which in the best case scenario will be lifted off the ground slightly, like on a stool or in a trash can full of ice) in front of you. Have the lifters stand to the left and right of the drinker, facing each other. The valve operator should stand wherever is easiest, most likely opposite the drinker.

steps.title: Grasp the handles of the keg and bend at the waist.
steps.content: Grasp the handles of the keg and bend at the waist. Do not grab the handles of the trash can (see Warnings). Each lifter should grab one of your legs, somewhere around the knee. The valve-person should insert the valve/spout of the tap into the your mouth, but don't start yet. (This may seem like a lousy job, but it's really important). [4] X Research source

steps.title: On the count of 3, all these things happen:
steps.content: On the count of 3, all these things happen: Push using arm and body strength, gently flinging legs sky-ward into the classic 'hand-stand' position. Don't worry, this is easier than it sounds because you have help. The lifters should help you get into said 'hand-stand' position by lifting the legs in an arc and guiding you up. Once there, hold steady. Once you are up, the valve operator will release the valve and hence the beer into your mouth.

steps.title: Once you are up, one of the lifters should be counting (One-Mississippi).
steps.content: Once you are up, one of the lifters should be counting (One-Mississippi). The higher the count the better! This final count can be used to ascertain which of your friends was up the longest. If you have the highest count you can use this to brag at the party or later.

steps.title: Consume as much beer as possible in said position, then give the agreed upon stop/get-signal.
steps.content: Consume as much beer as possible in said position, then give the agreed upon stop/get-signal. When the stop signal is given the lifter should stop counting. The lifters should then help you back into the standing position and the valve-operator should stop the flow of beer. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Celebrate!
steps.content: Celebrate! You did it! Switch-up and lift for your friend! When it comes to tricks like these, practice leads to perfection. For this trick in particular, aim to practice the position with your friends: only drink when performing the trick during a party etc.
